item.description:
This is a Yes Dance-I ask you to be respectful and say yes to anyone who asks you to dance once- please understand this is our number one value- if you are able to say yes then this is a great event for you to attend.

Format:
Location is in a safe, warm, loving and relaxing environment.

Admission: $12.00 plus wine or food assignment (quality)
DJ - Dancing will be available

If the first letter of your last name begins with the following-please bring:
A-C Dessert
D-F 2 bottles soda ( one diet, one regular) and 2 gallons of water
G Italian bread and butter
H-I vegetable tray with dip
J-Q Entrée – what ever you would like to bring – finger sandwiches, chicken, meatballs, (bring your favorite food selection, you would like to share with others),
R-Z wine or beer
Please NO CHIPS or crackers

**Of course if you are rushed, too busy, you may pay $20.00 and not bring anything.

The synergistic efforts of everyone will make it truly a memorable Dinner Dance party.

Organizer/Host- Richard Tosti

1. "Time of party: 7:30PM -11:30pm"
2. " Dress code- "business casual" -
no jeans/sneakers
3. "You can enjoy the music and dance if you like"
4. Initial temperature will be 68 for the first hour. Body heat will warm up the room to a comfortable 70-72 degrees in one hour.

Purpose is to Socialize with similar people of our age who are searching for a lifetime partner. 40-65 age group.

I began these parties in my home in July 2006-twice a month

Our common Values: Common denominator
Have fun meeting old and new friends
Circulate, talk to everyone.
If someone is alone go up to them and say, "Hi, Let's dance!"
Nonsmokers
Please be Friendly, Positive, and optimistic to everyone.

Please invite other friends, Particularly men. My personal goal is to have an equal amount of men and women

We usually have a close ratio of men and women. The last dance we had 45 women and 40 men. Pease invite quality men you know!

This group was formed on the principle of synergy. Working together to invite quality people. We must take responsibility for inviting people. Again, my personal goal is to have an equal ratio of men and women, hope you will help.

If there are more women it is because you invited women, not men.

You can sign up on http://dance.meetup.c...

130 guests only.

You know the time, the location, what you should bring. Let's have fun!

Location and Directions
Temple Shalom Emeth
16 Lexington Street
Burlington,MA

128 North
Exit 32 B Middlesex Tpk (Burlington/Arlington)
Fork right-Middlesex Tpk Burlington-on the left is Burlington Dodge/Barnes/Noble
Right on to Burlington Mall Rd-on left is Longs Jewelers
Take left after Kohls-Lexington Street
16 Lexington Street
Burlington MA

Two Parking lots on the right side of building. Enter through the side entrance .
3rd parking lot two houses up at Church-we have permission
4th parking lot across the street-McGinnis Ave-Mt Hope Church

See you on Nov. 29th, Sat.-7:30pm

The best is yet to be!

Richard Tosti
item.name: Private Singles Dinner/Dance Party 40-65
